name: frontally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
directly facing someone or something, or facing forwards: The subject of the photograph confronts his viewers frontally in black coat and hat. It was not the first time that the army had been frontally attacked from the north.
If you attack someone frontally, you criticize them very strongly. : If you attack the government frontally, you're unlikely to win. Here is a play that frontally attacks the government's abuse of human rights.
More examplesFewer examplesThe images that he photographed frontally from head to waist are his best.The male of the species has two frontally directed patches of green skin.The decision to attack frontally was foolish, and it proved fatal for him.
